methods_proposed.name: Naive Forecast (Last Value)
methods_proposed.description: Use last known production value as prediction

methods_proposed.name: Linear Regression
methods_proposed.description: Linear model using area and previous production as features
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_linear_regression(train_df, test_df, target_col, date_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
    # Select features from most recent year
    features = [\'Area-2023-24\', \'Production-2023-24\']
    X_train = train_df[features]
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    model = LinearRegression().fit(X_train, y_train)
    X_test = test_df[features]
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({\'predicted\': predictions}, index=test_df.index)

methods_proposed.name: Random Forest Regressor
methods_proposed.description: Ensemble model using all historical area/production features
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_random_forest(train_df, test_df, target_col, date_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
    # Use all area and production columns as features
    area_cols = [col for col in train_df.columns if col.startswith(\'Area-\')]
    prod_cols = [col for col in train_df.columns if col.startswith(\'Production-\') and col != target_col]
    features = area_cols + prod_cols
    X_train = train_df[features]
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42).fit(X_train, y_train)
    X_test = test_df[features]
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({\'predicted\': predictions}, index=test_df.index)
expected_weaknesses: Risk of overfitting with small data
